intro: Costus malortieanus var. amazonicus, commonly known as the Amazonian costus, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests.
